text: {|width=35% class="wikitable" style="float:right; font-size: 90%; text-align: left;" !colspan=2|Hull Pirates |- | colspan="2" style="text-align:center;"| |- ! colspan="2" style="text-align:center;"|Season 2015-16 |- |League||EPIHL |- |GM/Head Coach||Dominic Osman |- |Home Ice Rink||Hull Arena |- |League position||9th (of 10) |- |Premier Cup||Group Stage |- |Play-Offs||DNQ |} During the 2015-16 season, the Hull Pirates participated in the semi- professional English Premier Ice Hockey League. It was their first season as a club. After a run of seven straight defeats to start the season (pre-season and regular season) the club announced the release of club captain Jan Platil. ==Standings== ===English Premier League=== {| class="wikitable" style="text- align: center;" |- ! Team ! Pld. ! W ! OL ! L ! GF ! GA ! [*] Secured play-off berth ==Schedule and results== ===Pre- season=== The pre-season started with a defeat on home ice to the visiting Swindon Wildcats. Pre-season ended with a two-legged battle for the Bradfield Brewery Cup. Sheffield Steeldogs won both matches for an aggregate 10-7 victory which meant the Pirates were still awaiting their first-ever victory. {| class="wikitable" |+
